title: Lack of diversity in the Libyan parliament : percentage of minority representation
summary: The graph shows the Lack of diversity in percentage terms in the Libyan parliament across 5 year periods starting from 1990 .
In this initial 5 year period it showed less than 0.5 percentage of the people were from a minority representation .
However , the figures increased every 5 Years until by 2019 there was a 14.0 percentage representation of minorities in the Libyan parliament .
gold: Although at present 14 % of Parliament , there has been a strident increase in minority representation \n from near 0 in the early 90 's to 70 times the number over the 20 year period ( 1990 to 19 ) . \n That is rising from less than 0.5 % in 1990/94 to 10 % ten years later , and further 40 % to 14 % up to 2019 .
